definition: lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
old variant of 花[hua1]
variant of 花[hua1]/flower/blossom/also pr. [wei3]

sentences.english: A day is a tourist; a year is a traveller.
sentences.chinese: 一天只能走马看花，一年方能称之旅人。

sentences.english: He just rushed through the book .
sentences.chinese: 他只不过走马看花地看完了这本书。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, due to the time reason, we can only be a cursory looking at flowers.
sentences.chinese: 遗憾的是，由于时间的限制，我们也只能是走马看花。

definition: lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); a fleeting glance in passing/fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
to view/to look at/to look sth over
lit. not requiring a detailed understanding (idiom); only looking for an overview/not bothered with the details/superficial/content with shallow understanding
to go through the motions
to swallow in one gulp (idiom)/(fig.) to accept without thinking/to lap up

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
to go on foot (idiom)/to do things at a leisurely pace

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
to travel to a place personally (idiom)
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
to turn back/to backtrack/(fig.) to revert to the former way of doing things
to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears/out of touch with reality/to bury one's head in the sand
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
lit. a dragon's scale from the east and a dragon's claw from the west/odds and ends (idiom)
